result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary William Christianson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution and all applicable surcharges at the rate of $213.00 per month commencing 5/20/15.  Payments to be made through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with the owners of the Blew Inn.  Defendant shall not go on the premises of the Blew Inn.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to perform 20 hours of community service per count to be done within the first year of probation in lieu of costs.

records.addlTxt:
(3:35) Defendant, Gary William Christianson in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. wishes to plead today; State submits restitution forms and recomm. (1 year of probation may not be sufficient for amount of restitution owed); Court reviews recomm.; Def. will proceed; Court reviews right to counsel; Court reviews charges/penalties; Def. pleads NC to Count 1 Theft and NC to Count 3 Conceiling Stolen Property; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; State heard on facts; Court finds pleas and waiver made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Counts 1 and 3 w/Count 2 D&RI; State heard; Def. heard; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 18 Months PO
- Restituiton of $3,834.82 to Blew Inn - first payment due in a month - $213 by 5/20/15; Payments to be made through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office
- 20 hours community service per count to be done within the first year of probation in lieu of costs
- Not go on the premises of the Blew Inn or have contact with the owners of the Blew Inn

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with the owners of Blew Inn, J.S.R. dob 12/3/64 or R.E.Z., dob 6/4/42. Defendant shall not go on the premises of the Blew Inn, W7115 STH 60/16, Clyman, WI.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

(12:45) Defendant Gary William Christianson in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (jail only).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond conditions; RD 4/20/15 at 3:30pm & JT 5/27/15 at 8:30am in Br. 1; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with owners of Blew Inn, J.S.R. and R.E.Z.    Defendant shall not go on the premises at Defendant shall not go on the premises of the Blew Inn, W7115 State Highway 60/16, Clyman, WI.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
